snippet: General Motors said its third-quarter earnings fell 14 percent on larger losses in Europe and less profitable operations in North America.
abstract: General Motors reports third-quarter net income of $1.48 billion, down from $1.73 billion in same period a year earlier, exceeding Wall Street expectations; cites profits in every world region except Europe, where it once again extended one of the longest losing streaks in auto industry.
lead_paragraph: General Motors said its third-quarter earnings fell 14 percent on larger losses in Europe and less profitable operations in North America.

headline.seo: Like Other Automakers, G.M. Earnings Are Hurt by European Losses
headline.main: Like Other Automakers, G.M. Has Earnings Hurt by a Loss in Europe
headline.print_headline: Like Other Automakers, G.M. Has Earnings Hurt by a Loss in Europe
